title: Japanese destroyer Nagatsuki (1906)
text:
("Month of long night") was one of 32 <a href="destroyer">destroyer</a>s built for the <a href="Imperial%20Japanese%20Navy">Imperial Japanese Navy</a> (IJN) in the first decade of the 20th century.
Design and description.
The "Kamikaze"-class destroyers were improved versions of the preceding . They <a href="Displacement%20%28ship%29">displaced</a> at normal load and at <a href="deep%20load">deep load</a>. The ships had a <a href="length%20between%20perpendiculars">length between perpendiculars</a> of and an <a href="length%20overall">overall length</a> of , a <a href="beam%20%28nautical%29">beam</a> of and a <a href="draft%20%28ship%29">draught</a> of . The "Kamikaze"s were powered by two <a href="Marine%20steam%20engine%23Triple%20or%20multiple%20expansion">vertical triple-expansion steam engines</a>, each driving one shaft using steam produced by four <a href="Kampon">Kampon</a> <a href="water-tube%20boiler">water-tube boiler</a>s. The engines produced a total of that gave the ships a maximum speed of . They carried a maximum of of coal which gave them a range of at a speed of . Their crew consisted of 70 officers and <a href="naval%20rating">ratings</a>.
The main armament of the "Kamikaze"-class ships consisted of two 40-<a href="caliber%20%28artillery%29">calibre</a> <a href="quick-firing%20gun">quick-firing (QF)</a> <a href="QF%2012%20pounder%2012%20cwt%20naval%20gun">12 cwt guns</a> on single mounts; the forward gun was located on <a href="superstructure">superstructure</a>, but the aft gun was at the <a href="stern">stern</a>. Four 28-calibre QF <a href="QF%2012-pounder%208%20cwt%20gun">three-inch 8 cwt guns</a> on single mounts were positioned abreast the superstructure, two in each <a href="Broadside%20%28naval%29">broadside</a>. The ships were also armed with two single rotating mounts for <a href="torpedo">torpedo</a>es between the superstructure and the stern gun. When "Nagatsuki" was converted into a minesweeper in 1924, she was rearmed with a pair of <a href="12%20cm/45%203rd%20Year%20Type%20naval%20gun">3rd Year Type guns</a> taken from older ships on single mounts and the three-inch 8 cwt guns were removed.
Construction and career.
"Nagatsuki" was <a href="Ship%20launching">launched</a> at the <a href="Uraga%20Dock%20Company">Uraga Dock Company</a>'s <a href="shipyard">shipyard</a> in <a href="Uraga%2C%20Kanagawa">Uraga, Kanagawa</a>, on 15 December 1906 and completed on 31 July 1907. The ship saw service in World War I and was converted into a <a href="Minesweeper%20%28ship%29">minesweeper</a> on 1 December 1924. She was renamed "W-11" on 1 August 1928. The ship was <a href="Ship%20decommissioning">decommissioned</a> on 1 June 1930 and subsequently broken up.
